content: 1 trelawny shawl trelawny is a wide triangular shawl shaped to sit well on the shoulders it is worked from the top down with increases at the edges and centre of the shawl on every row this shawl was designed for gradient yarns but it would also work well in one solid colour or striped using mini skeins/ scrap yarn materials 200g 4 ply/fingering weight yarn sample used scheepjes whirl in the green tea tipple colourway 3mm hook or size needed to obtain gauge one locking stitch marker gauge 19 st and 10 row over 10cm unblocked correct gauge is not essential for this pattern abbreviations chain = chain double_crochet = us double_crochet = uk treble_crochet space = space instructions foundation row chain 4 slip_stitch into first chain to form a ring turn row 1 chain 5 3 double_crochet into ring chain 1 3 double_crochet into ring chain 1 3 double_crochet into ring chain 1 double_crochet into ring turn place marker into top of middle stitch of central 3 double_crochet cluster row 2 chain 5 3 double_crochet into chain 1 space chain 1 3 double_crochet into chain 1 space chain 1 3 double_crochet into marked stitch move maker to middle stitch of 3 double_crochet just worked chain 1 3 double_crochet into next chain 1 space chain 1 3 double_crochet into turning chain space chain 1 1 double_crochet into 4th chain of turning chain turn milobo_makes trelawny shawl v 1 ©michelle bond 2018 2 row 3 chain 5 3 double_crochet into chain 1 space chain 1 repeat to central 3 double_crochet cluster 3 double_crochet into marked stitch move marker to middle of 3 double_crochet just worked chain 1 3 double_crochet into next chain 1 space chain 1 repeat to end 3 double_crochet into turning chain space chain 1 1 double_crochet into 4th chain of turning chain turn repeat row 3 until shawl is of desired size border chain 1 single_crochet into each double_crochet and chain space to end single_crochet into top of turning chain fasten milobo_makes trelawny shawl v 1 ©michelle bond 2018
